summary: Trump claimed that the federal government should not be responsible for healthcare and that it should be privately done. He argued that there is a lack of competition in the healthcare industry.
Trump claimed that he doesn't want more nuclear weapons in the world, but he is okay with Japan and South Korea having them.
Donald Trump was asked by Anderson Cooper about his previous pledge to support the Republican nominee, regardless of who it may be, and how things have changed since then.

During the debate, Trump claimed that he did not mislead anyone and that he was not aware of the security cameras. He also stated that once he found out about the cameras, he believed they would exonerate him. Additionally, Trump mentioned that the woman in question went to the ground and was in pain.
